project.teaser: The IAM4RAIL project focuses on seven (7) different integrated demonstrators for rail assets which are key for research and innovation (R&I) in the rail sector. Integrating asset condition information obtained via advanced monitoring with decision-making tools and into the...
project.objective: The IAM4RAIL project focuses on seven (7) different integrated demonstrators for rail assets which are key for research and innovation (R&I) in the rail sector. Integrating asset condition information obtained via advanced monitoring with decision-making tools and into the traffic management system (TMS), combining available information with artificial intelligence (AI) and digital twins are covered as key topics for R&I in IAM4RAIL. Other topics such as interventions using cutting-edge technologies as robotics or additive manufacturing are seen as relevant for improving asset management in the rail sector. An European cross-border, interoperable and holistic integrated approach is needed for those topics and others in the asset management framework, that are to be transferred once developed crucial to harmonise European Rail System. Therefore, IAM4RAIL aims to reinforce the next generation of Intelligent and Integrated Rail Asset Management providing and demonstrating innovative solutions covering fixed and rolling stock assets, minimizing the life cycle costs of assets and extend their lifetime, while meeting safety requirements and improving the reliability, availability and maintainability of the rail system. IAM4RAIL will pave the way for the integration of asset condition information and TMS, enabling optimization of train routing decisions and improving the overall lifecycle of monitored assets. IAM4RAIL ensures an increased volume of rail traffic in existing lines with improved cost efficiency and lower CO2 emissions from their maintenance and operations. Furthermore, construction time and cost of new assets and lines are reduced, the durability and reliability of their assets increased, and their life cycle costs are optimized. Competitiveness of the European railway industry is strengthened through the obtention of more qualified products, and its application improves the performance (capacity, flexibility and punctuality) of the whole railway system.
project.title: Europe’s Rail Flagship Project 3 - Holistic and Integrated Asset Management for Europe’s RAIL System
project.keywords: Rail Asset Management, Intelligent Assets, Holistic Asset Management, Rail Robotics, Rail decision-making tools, Cutting-edge technologies,Rolling stock Condition Based Maintenance,Advanced monitoring

article.title: Improving rail asset management in Europe

category.title: Project description
category.description: Article: description of linked project written by editorial team

result.title: Transfer learning for improved generalizability in causal physics-informed neural networks for beam simulations

details.authors: Taniya Kapoor, Hongrui Wang, Alfredo Nez, Rolf Dollevoet

result.title: Project dissemination and communication plan Update
result.description: The Communication and dissemination plan will have a final update in M30 with the same aims, objectives and contents than D20.1. All partners collaborate in this deliverable.

result.title: Fatigue Crack Propagation on Uniaxial Loading of Biaxially Predeformed Pearlitic Rail Steel

details.authors: Daniel Gren, Johan Ahlström Johan Ahlström

result.title: Report on the initial developments and preparatory works for the integrated demo
result.description: This report contains the preparatory to works for the integrated demo to be carried out in WP11and also will consider all the holistic developments and quick wins.

result.title: Definition of Use Cases, including Innovation, Business Assessment, KPIs definition and roadmap (second issue)
result.description: Update of D2.6 with the progress of the work, business cases defined and elaborated by WP, link definition to socioeconomic objectives, business assessment and innovation defining how the proposed developments go beyond the state-of-the-art. Including specific KPIs at a WP level,. and, when applicable, the agreements reached with other FPs in the specific Work Packages.

result.title: Architecture Input Requirements Consolidation first version
result.description: First consolidated version of the architecture requirements inputs from the System Pillar.

result.title: Technical/Impact KPIs report (initial)
result.description: Initial report on KPIs model development, baseline and expected contribution (credible pathway to be developed) to the expected Impacts.

result.title: Public summary with the strategy to measure and process data for Bogie & Drive components
result.description: Report including a short summary on the main results of D5.1 and D5.2.

result.title: Analysis of Local Track Discontinuities and Defects in Railway Switches Based on Track-Side Accelerations

details.authors: Susanne Reetz, Taoufik Najeh, Jan Lundberg, Jörn Groos

result.title: Enhanced vertical railway track quality index with dynamic responses from moving trains

details.authors: Siwarak Unsiwilai, Wassamon Phusakulkajorn, Chen Shen, Arjen Zoeteman, Rolf Dollevoet, Alfredo Nez, Zili Li

result.title: Preparation of integrated demonstrator report on IAMS Vision, Validation & Architecture Report
result.description: D3.1 will report on the vision, the validation strategy and the architecture definition of a IAMS system architecture for WP3 activities, the implementation of the Open Standard Interfaces, providing the guidelines to allow demonstrators to implement the system architecture and define the validation process.

result.title: Railway Track Support Condition Assessment: From Onboard Measurement to Maintenance Decision Support
Ethics independent assessment
result.description: The ethical assessment will be focused on the WP19 activities. It will take the shape of an ex-ante analysis and an analysis of issues that might occur due to the interaction of users, technology, and work context, considering the demonstration in M36.

result.title: User and functional specifications for Multi-purpose resilient adaptative On-board telecom networks
result.description: User and functional specifications for the wireless system based on existing and available frequency bands. ST 6.4.1.

result.title: Project dissemination and communication plan
result.description: The Communication and dissemination plan will be produced outlining the target audiences, including stakeholder mapping. It would design key messages and specific channels, timing schedule, and partners roles and responsibilities. It will include the project visual identity and website. It consists of the project’s website, to communicate, inform, create dialogue and promote use of the project results among the target stakeholder groups. All the partners collaborate in this deliverable. (First version of this plan produced in M6; updated versions of the plan produced in M30).

result.title: A Digital-Cooperative Framework for Cross-border Railway Maintenance Decision Support
Demonstrator Vision & Architecture global for Railway checkpoint
result.description: D7.1 will present the work related to task T7.1 gathering the final conclusions on how the demonstrator should be implemented and the overall railway architecture for both freight and passenger trains, able to be deployed on the European rail network.

result.title: Physics-Informed Neural Networks for Solving Forward and Inverse Problems in Complex Beam Systems

details.authors: Taniya Kapoor, Hongrui Wang, Alfredo Nnez, Rolf Dollevoet
details.journalTitle: IEEE Transactions on Neural Networks and Learning Systems
details.publisher: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)

result.title: Definition of Use Cases, including Innovation, Business Assessment, KPIs definition and roadmap (first issue)
result.description: Business cases defined and elaborated by WP, link definition to socioeconomic objectives, business assessment and innovation defining how the proposed developments go beyond the state-of-the-art. Including specific KPIs including the target baseline at a WP level. The deliverable will include a chapter on innovation management and synergies/risk of duplication of work. This deliverable includes a table with the demonstrators and the TRL level and, when applicable, the agreements reached with other FPs in the specific Work Packages.

result.title: A Train-Borne Laser Vibrometer Solution Based on Multisignal Fusion for Self-Contained Railway Track Monitoring

details.authors: Yuanchen Zeng, Alfredo Núñez, Rolf Dollevoet, Arjen Zoeteman, Zili Li
details.publisher: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)

result.title: Analysis of the outputs from WP5
result.description: Report including the analysis related to sensing identified and developed

result.title: Physics-informed machine learning: from methods to beam structures
Railway Track Geometry Irregularity Assessment Using Smartphone Accelerometers. File under embargo until 01-07-2025
Civil Engineering requirements, architecture, inspection and monitoring report
result.description: D12.1 presents the requirements and the architecture of the technologies across WP12 and WP13. It also presents the installation and data collection from monitoring and inspection systems, setting the baseline for the work around civil assets to be performed in WP13.

result.title: AI solutions for maintenance decision support in railway infrastructure
Workplace analysis and specifications
result.description: Report with specifications and requirements from the use cases defined (T19.1).

details.authors: Taniya Kapoor, Hongrui Wang, Anastasios Stamou, Kareem El Sayed, Alfredo Nez, Daniel M. Tartakovsky, Rolf Dollevoet
details.publisher: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)

result.title: High-Level System Architecture
result.description: This deliverable will provide a preliminary High-Level Architecture describing the approach.

details.authors: Yuanchen Zeng, Alfredo Nez, Zili Li

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - FP3 - IAM4RAIL (Europe’s Rail Flagship Project 3 - Holistic and Integrated Asset Management for Europe’s RAIL System)
result.teaser: The FP3 – IAM4RAIL flagship project aims to transform the rail sector by providing innovative technical solutions and services, leveraging cutting-edge technologies to minimize asset lifecycle costs, enhance safety, and improve the reliability, availability, and capacity of...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Common Framework Orientations
result.description: The report contains the justification of the choice of the common robotics middleware, the description of the principles that are used for the overlay for advanced modularity and the Safety Assessment Method. It describes the possible constraints coming from the overlay and the Safety Assessment Method on Software and Hardware development. The Vision of the impacts of robotics on railway asset management are also included (T18.1 and T18.2).

category.title: robotics
category.displayCode: /engineering and technology/electrical engineering, electronic engineering, information engineering/electronic engineering/robotics

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
